English (United States)(en-US): I was standing on the edge of a cliff.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 벼랑 끝에 서 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Beyond was the colossal predator. A silent and fathomless mouth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너머에는 거대한 포식자. 고요하고 시커먼 목구멍.

English (United States)(en-US): Death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음.

English (United States)(en-US): I dared try and make sense of the endless drop.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 그 끝없는 낙차를 감히 이해해 보려고 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Fit it in the palm of my hand, and lend an ear to its lonesome whispers.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것을 손에 쥐고 더듬어 보려, 그의 외로운 속삭임에 귀 기울여 보려 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought then I could accept my fate... that is, being devoured by it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 그에게 먹히게 될 나의 미래를… 가까스로 받아들일 수 있을 것만 같았어.

English (United States)(en-US): But the abyss denied a wandering eye.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 심연은 엿보는 것을 허락하지 않았고,

English (United States)(en-US): And… I tripped. Or did I, blinded by despair, choose to fall?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는… 발을 헛디뎠던가. 절망에 눈이 멀어 떨어져 내리길 자처했던가?

English (United States)(en-US): I just can’t remember.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 도통 기억이 나질 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Everything was d a r k.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깜 깜 해 졌 어.

English (United States)(en-US): The Dark. Where everything is the same, eyes closed or open.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳은 수렁 같은 암흑. 눈을 떠도 감아도 똑같은 것이 보이는.

English (United States)(en-US): Where things, far more crowded and woeful than death, lurk.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음보다 훨씬 서럽고 빽빽한 것들이 도사리는.

English (United States)(en-US): Where there is n o t h i n g. And thus e v e r y t h i n g.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아 무것 도 없는. 그렇기에 모 든 것 이 있는.

English (United States)(en-US): And the fog. The nameless fog.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 안개. 이름 없는 안개.

English (United States)(en-US): Things approached and began to s w e l l.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것들이 찾아와 거 대 하게 불어나기 시작했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Screams unheard. Sobs. Sorrows. Wrongs.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 묵음 처리된 비명들. 울음. 설움. 억울함.

English (United States)(en-US): Things born in the Dark, resembling the chilling nature of the Dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑에서 태어나, 암흑의 섬뜩한 감각을 닮아 있는

English (United States)(en-US): Questions. Questions. Questions. Questions.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 질문들. 질문들. 질문들. 질문들.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘Why are dreams not dreams? Why bodiless and colorless? Do they die when daylight comes?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘왜 꿈은 꿈이 아닌 거야? 몸과 색이 없는 거야? 낮이 오면 죽는 거야?’

English (United States)(en-US): ‘Are all colors nothing but falsehood? Is the world merely a cruel bystander?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘모오든 색채는 허상이었던 거야? 세계는 잔혹한 방관자일 뿐이었던 거야?’

English (United States)(en-US): ‘Then what am I? What am I, what can I be?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘그렇다면 나는 뭐지? 나는 무엇밖에 못 되며, 무엇까지 될 수 있지?’

English (United States)(en-US): ‘If nothing. Then what does it mean to exist? Am I merely a carcass-to-be?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘아무것도 될 수 없었다면. 존재한다는 건 뭐지? 나 역시 예비-사체였던 거야?’
